alert.note: Alert for Central Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 2:54PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Sagavanirktok River near Dalton Highway from Mileposts 401 to 407. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flood waters are eroding the Dalton Highway between Milepost 401 and 407, with the road down to one lane. If conditions worsen, the road may wash out and become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 230 PM AKDT Thursday, the Sagavanirktok River continues to flow overbank due to remnant ice in the main channel. This is forcing the water to flow west and cause erosion along the Dalton Highway from Milepost 401 to 407. These conditions are expected to persist until ice in the main channel clears. - Rain falling in the headwaters of the Sagavanirktok River earlier this week is expected move down river through Friday. This will result in high water levels on the Sagavanirktok River from near Pump Station 3 to the coast into Friday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
